page.title: 01SEAHOUSES
page.content: { Seahouses}is a small village in the North of Northumberland with a resident population of 2000. Seahouses depends mainly on Fishing and Tourism for it livelihood. It is situated on a beautiful part of the coast which is designated as a an area of outstanding natural beauty with miles of fine sands and dunes to the north and south. The village shops cater both for the residents of the area and in the summer for the hundreds of visitors who have to be fed and entertained. There are activities for the visitor such as: Amusements, Bingo, Golf, Bowls, Boat trips to the Farne Islands, Riding Stables and Bus Trips to places of interest including Edinburgh.
